memberdef.argsstring: (const Polygon_2< Kernel, Container > &pgn1, const Polygon_2< Kernel, Container > &pgn2, OutputIterator oi)
memberdef.name: intersection

briefdescription.para: computes the intersection of two polygons and inserts the resulting polygons with holes into a container via an output iterator.

parameterdescription.para: the 1st input polygon.
the 2nd input polygon.
the output iterator for the result. Its dereference type must be convertible to Polygon_with_holes_2<Kernel, Container>.

simplesect.para: the past-the-end iterator of the output container.

memberdef.argsstring: (const Polygon_2< Kernel, Container > &pgn1, const Polygon_2< Kernel, Container > &pgn2, OutputIterator oi, UsePolylines=Tag_true())
memberdef.name: intersection

briefdescription.para: computes the intersection of two polygons and inserts the resulting polygons with holes into a container via an output iterator.

parameterdescription.para: determines whether the boundary of pgn is treated as a cyclic sequence of single ( $x$-monotone) segments or as a cyclic sequence of ( $x$-monotone) polylines. If substituted with CGAL::Tag_true, which is the default, pgn is converted to a general polygon bounded by polylines before the operation is actually performed. Then, the resulting general polygon with holes is converted back to a standard polygon. If substituted with CGAL::Tag_false, pgn is used as is. Refer to Traits Selection for more information.
the 1st input polygon.
the 2nd input polygon.
the output iterator for the result. Its dereference type must be convertible to Polygon_with_holes_2<Kernel, Container>.

simplesect.para: the past-the-end iterator of the output container.

memberdef.argsstring: (const Polygon_2< Kernel, Container > &pgn1, const Polygon_with_holes_2< Kernel, Container > &pgn2, OutputIterator oi)

simplesect.para: the past-the-end iterator of the output container.

memberdef.name: intersection

briefdescription.para: computes the intersection of two polygons and inserts the resulting polygons with holes into a container via an output iterator.

parameterdescription.para: determines whether the boundaries of pgn1 and pgn2 are treated as cyclic sequences of single ( $x$-monotone) segments or as a cyclic sequences of ( $x$-monotone) polylines. If substituted with CGAL::Tag_true, which is the default, pgn1 and pgn2 are converted to a general polygons bounded by polylines before the operation is actually performed. Then, the resulting general polygons with holes are converted back to standard polygons with holes. If substituted with CGAL::Tag_false, pgn1 and pgn2 are used as is. Refer to Traits Selection for more information.
the 1st input polygon.
the 2nd input polygon.
the output iterator for the result. Its dereference type must be convertible to Polygon_with_holes_2<Kernel, Container>.

simplesect.para: the past-the-end iterator of the output container.

parameterdescription.para: the 1st input polygon.

memberdef.name: intersection

briefdescription.para: computes the intersection of two polygons and inserts the resulting polygons with holes into a container via an output iterator.

parameterdescription.para: determines whether the boundaries of pgn1 and pgn2 are treated as cyclic sequences of single ( $x$-monotone) segments or as a cyclic sequences of ( $x$-monotone) polylines. If substituted with CGAL::Tag_true, which is the default, pgn1 and pgn2 are converted to a general polygon and a general polygon with holes, respectively, bounded by polylines before the operation is actually performed. Then, the resulting general polygons with holes are converted back to standard polygons with holes. If substituted with CGAL::Tag_false, pgn1 and pgn2 are used as is. Refer to Traits Selection for more information.
the 1st input polygon.
the 2nd input polygon.
the output iterator for the result. Its dereference type must be convertible to Polygon_with_holes_2<Kernel, Container>.

simplesect.para: the past-the-end iterator of the output container.

parameterdescription.para: the 1st input polygon.
the 2nd input polygon.
the output iterator for the result. Its dereference type must be convertible to General_polygon_with_holes_2<General_polygon_2<ArrTraits>>.

simplesect.para: the past-the-end iterator of the output container.
ArrTraits must be a model of the concept ArrangementDirectionalXMonotoneTraits_2.

memberdef.name: intersection

briefdescription.para: Given a range of polygons (respectively general polygons) or a range of polygons with holes (respectively general polygons with holes) computes the intersection of all polygons in the range and inserts the resulting polygons with holes (respectively general polygons with holes) into a container via an output iterator.

parameterdescription.para: the first iterator of the input range. Its value type is either Polygon_2 (respectively General_polygon_2) or Polygon_with_holes_2 (respectively General_polygon_with_holes_2).
the past-the-end iterator of the input range. Its value type is either Polygon_2 (respectively General_polygon_2) or Polygon_with_holes_2 (respectively General_polygon_with_holes_2).
the output iterator for the result. Its dereference type must be convertible to Polygon_with_holes_2 (respectively General_polygon_with_holes_2).

simplesect.para: the past-the-end iterator of the output container.

memberdef.argsstring: (InputIterator begin, InputIterator end, OutputIterator oi, UsePolylines=Tag_true())
memberdef.name: intersection

briefdescription.para: Given a range of polygons (respectively general polygons) or a range of polygons with holes (respectively general polygons with holes) computes the intersection of all polygons in the range and inserts the resulting polygons with holes (respectively general polygons with holes) into a container via an output iterator.

parameterdescription.para: determines whether the boundaries of the polygons in the input range are treated as cyclic sequences of single ( $x$-monotone) segments or as a cyclic sequences of ( $x$-monotone) polylines. If substituted with CGAL::Tag_true, which is the default, the input polygons are converted to general polygon with holes , bounded by polylines before the operation is actually performed. Then, the resulting general polygons with holes are converted back to standard polygons with holes. If substituted with CGAL::Tag_false, pgn1 and pgn2 are used as is. Refer to Traits Selection for more information.
the first iterator of the input range. Its value type is either Polygon_2 (respectively General_polygon_2) or Polygon_with_holes_2 (respectively General_polygon_with_holes_2).
the past-the-end iterator of the input range. Its value type is either Polygon_2 (respectively General_polygon_2) or Polygon_with_holes_2 (respectively General_polygon_with_holes_2).
the output iterator for the result. Its dereference type must be convertible to Polygon_with_holes_2 (respectively General_polygon_with_holes_2).

simplesect.para: the past-the-end iterator of the output container.

memberdef.argsstring: (InputIterator1 begin1, InputIterator1 end1, InputIterator2 begin2, InputIterator2 end2, OutputIterator oi)
memberdef.name: intersection

parameterdescription.para: the first iterator of the 1st input range. Its value type is Polygon_2 (respectively General_polygon_2).
the past-the-end iterator of the 1st input range. Its value type is Polygon_2 (respectively General_polygon_2).

the output iterator for the result. Its dereference type must be convertible to Polygon_with_holes_2 (respectively General_polygon_with_holes_2).

simplesect.para: the past-the-end iterator of the output container.

briefdescription.para: Given a range of polygons (respectively general polygons) and a range of polygons with holes (respectively general polygons with holes) computes the intersection of all polygons in the two ranges and inserts the resulting polygons with holes (respectively general polygons with holes) into a container via an output iterator.

parameterdescription.para: determines whether the boundaries of the polygons in the input ranges are treated as cyclic sequences of single ( $x$-monotone) segments or as a cyclic sequences of ( $x$-monotone) polylines. If substituted with CGAL::Tag_true, which is the default, the input polygons are converted to general polygon with holes , bounded by polylines before the operation is actually performed. Then, the resulting general polygons with holes are converted back to standard polygons with holes. If substituted with CGAL::Tag_false, pgn1 and pgn2 are used as is. Refer to Traits Selection for more information.

the output iterator for the result. Its dereference type must be convertible to Polygon_with_holes_2 (respectively General_polygon_with_holes_2).

simplesect.para: the past-the-end iterator of the output container.

briefdescription.para: Given a range of polygons (respectively general polygons) or a range of polygons with holes (respectively general polygons with holes) computes the intersection of all polygons in the range and inserts the resulting polygons with holes (respectively general polygons with holes) into a container via an output iterator.

the past-the-end iterator of the input range. Its value type is either Polygon_2 (respectively General_polygon_2) or Polygon_with_holes_2 (respectively General_polygon_with_holes_2).
the output iterator for the result. Its dereference type must be convertible to Polygon_with_holes_2 (respectively General_polygon_with_holes_2).
a traits object.

simplesect.para: the past-the-end iterator of the output container.
GpsTraits must be a model of GeneralPolygonSetTraits_2.

memberdef.name: intersection

briefdescription.para: Given a range of polygons (respectively general polygons) and a range of polygons with holes (respectively general polygons with holes) computes the intersection between all polygons in the two ranges and inserts the resulting polygons with holes (respectively general polygons with holes) into a container via an output iterator.

parameterdescription.para: the first iterator of the 1st input range. Its value type is Polygon_2 (respectively General_polygon_2).
the past-the-end iterator of the 1st input range. Its value type is Polygon_2 (respectively General_polygon_2).
the first iterator of the 2nd input range. Its value type is Polygon_with_holes_2 (respectively General_polygon_with_holes_2).
the past-the-end iterator of the 2nd input range. Its value type is Polygon_with_holes_2 (respectively General_polygon_with_holes_2).
the output iterator for the result. Its dereference type must be convertible to Polygon_with_holes_2 (respectively General_polygon_with_holes_2).
a traits object.

simplesect.para: the past-the-end iterator of the output container.
GpsTraits must be a model of GeneralPolygonSetTraits_2.

detaileddescription.para: There are several overloaded function templates called intersection() that compute the intersection of two or more polygons and insert the resulting polygons with holes into a container via an output iterator.

parameterdescription.para: determines whether the boundaries of the input polygons are treated as cyclic sequences of single ( $x$-monotone) segments or as cyclic sequences of ( $x$-monotone) polylines. If substituted with CGAL::Tag_true, which is the default, the input polygons are converted to general polygons bounded by polylines before the operation is actually performed. Then, the resulting general polygons with holes are converted back to standard polygons with holes. If substituted with CGAL::Tag_false, the input polygons are used as is. Refer to Traits Selection for more information.
the output iterator for the result.

listitem.para: The types Type1 and Type2 of the parameters and of InputIterator1::value_type and InputIterator2::value_type must be convertible to the types specified in a row in the table below, respectively. The 3rd column specifies the corresponding dereference type of the output iterator.
The types that apply to signatures (1.1.) and (5.1.) above are restricted to those listed in rows 14 in the table below.
The types that apply to signatures (1.2.) and (5.2.) above are restricted to those listed in rows 58 in the table below.
The type of InputIterator::value_type in (3.1.) above must be convertible to either Polygon_2 or Polygon_with_holes_2.
The type of InputIterator::value_type in (3.2.) above must be convertible to either General_polygon_2 or General_polygon_with_holes_2.

parameterdescription.para: the input polygons.
a range of input polygons.
the first range of input polygons.
the second range of input polygons.
the output iterator for the result.
an optional traits object.
